Home > external > kegg > getKEGGModelForOrganism.m

getKEGGModelForOrganism

PURPOSE

getKEGGModelForOrganism

SYNOPSIS

function model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioG,minScoreRatioKO,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

DESCRIPTION 

 getKEGGModelForOrganism
   Reconstructs a genome-scale metabolic model based on protein homology to the
   orthologies in KEGG

   organismID          three or four letter abbreviation of the organism
                       (as used in KEGG). If not available, use a closely
                       related species. This is used for determing the
                       phylogenetic distance. Use 'eukaryotes' or
                       'prokaryotes' to get a model for the whole domain.
                       Only applicable if fastaFile is empty, i.e. no
                       homology search should be performed
   fastaFile           a FASTA file that contains the protein sequences of
                       the organism for which to reconstruct a model (opt,
                       if no FASTA file is supplied then a model is
                       reconstructed based only on the organism
                       abbreviation. This option ignores all settings
                       except for keepUndefinedStoich, keepIncomplete and
                       keepGeneral)
   dataDir             directory for which to retrieve the input data.
                       Should contain a combination of these sub-folders:
                       -dataDir\keggdb
                           The KEGG database files used in 1a (see below)
                       -dataDir\fasta
                           The multi-FASTA files generated in 1b (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\aligned
                           The aligned FASTA files as generated in 2a (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\hmms
                           The hidden Markov models as generated in 2b or
                           downloaded from BioMet Toolbox (see below)
                       The final directory in dataDir should be styled as
                       proXXX_keggYY or eukXXX_keggYY, indicating whether
                       the HMMs were trained on pro- or eukaryotic
                       sequences, using a sequence similarity threshold of
                       XXX %, fitting the KEGG version YY. E.g.
                       euk100_kegg82. (opt, see note about fastaFile. Note
                       that in order to rebuild the KEGG model from a
                       database dump, as opposed to using the version
                       supplied with RAVEN, you would still need to supply
                       this)
   outDir              directory to save the results from the quering of
                       the hidden Markov models. The output is specific
                       for the input sequences and the settings used. It
                       is stored in this manner so that the function can
                       continue if interrupted or if it should run in
                       parallel. Be careful not to leave output files from
                       different organisms or runs with different settings
                       in the same folder. They will not be overwritten
                       (opt, default is a temporary dir where all *.out
                       files are deleted before and after doing the
                       reconstruction)
   keepUndefinedStoich    include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
                       (opt, default true)
   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
                       such reactions (opt, default false)
   cutOff              significance score from HMMer needed to assign
                       genes to a KO (opt, default 10^-50)
   minScoreRatioG      a gene is only assigned to KOs for which the score
                       is >=log(score)/log(best score) for that gene. This
                       is to prevent thata gene which clearly belongs to
                       one KO is assigned also to KOs with much lower
                       scores (opt, default 0.8 (lower is less strict))
   minScoreRatioKO     ignore genes in a KO if their score is
                       <log(score)/log(best score in KO). This is to
                       "prune" KOs which havemany genes and where some are
                       clearly a better fit (opt, default 0.3 (lower is
                       less strict))
   maxPhylDist         -1: only use sequences from the same domain
                       (Prokaryota, Eukaryota)
                       other (positive) value: only use sequences for
                       organisms where the phylogenetic distance is at the
                       most this large (as calculated in getPhylDist)
                       (opt, default Inf, which means that all sequences
                       will be used)
   nSequences          for each KO, use up to this many sequences from the
                       most closely related species. This is mainly to
                       speed up the alignment process for KOs with very
                       many genes. This subsampling is performed before
                       running CD-HIT (opt, default inf)
   seqIdentity         sequence identity threshold in CD-HIT, referred as
                       "global sequence identity" in CD-HIT User's Guide.
                       The only possible options are 1 (100 %), 0.9 (90 %)
                       and 0.5 (50 %). If other values are provided,
                       CD-HIT is skipped (opt, default -1, i.e. CD-HIT is
                       skipped)

   model               the reconstructed model

   PLEASE READ THIS: The input to this function can be confusing, because
   it is intended to be run in parallel on a cluster or in multiple
   sessions. It therefore saves a lot of intermediate results to storage.
   This also serves the purpose of not having to do redundant
   calculations. This, however, comes with the disadvantage of somewhat
   trickier handling. This is what this function does:

   1a. Loads files from a local KEGG FTP dump and constructs a general
       RAVEN model representing the metabolic network. KEGG FTP access
       requires a <a href="matlab:
       web('http://www.bioinformatics.jp/en/keggftp.html')">license</a>.
   1b. Generates FASTA files from the KEGG FTP dump (see 1a). One
       multi-FASTA file for each KO in KEGG is generated. Make sure you
       actually need these first, as the parsing is time-consuming (see
       below).

   These steps only have to be re-done every time KEGG updates their
   database (or rather when the updates are large enough to warrant
   rerunning this part). Many user would probably never use this feature.

   2a. Does alignment of the multi-FASTA files for future use. This uses
       the settings "useEvDist" and "nSequences" to control which
       sequences should be used for constructing Hidden Markov models
       (HMMs), and later for matching your sequences to.
   2b. Trains hidden Markov models using HMMer for each of the aligned
       FASTA files.

   The most common alternatives here would be to use sequences from only
   eukaryotes, only prokaryotes or all sequences in KEGG. As explained in
   the README.md file, various sets of pre-trained hidden Markov models are
   available at <a href="matlab:
   web('http://biomet-toolbox.chalmers.se/index.php?page=downtools-raven')">BioMet
   Toolbox</a>. This is normally the most convenient way, but if you would
   like to use, for example, only fungal sequences for training the HMMs
   then you need to run this part.

   3a. Queries the HMMs with sequences for the organism you are making a
       model for. This step uses both the output from step 1a and from 2b.
   3b. Constructs a model based on the fit to the HMMs and the chosen
       parameters.

   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are
   reconstructing the model.

   In principle the function looks at which output that is already available
   and runs only the parts that are required for step 3. This means
   that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   -1b is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   OR multi-FASTA files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this
   step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead
   (see above). If not all files exist it will try to find
   the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2a is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped
   if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2b is only performed if not all required HMMs exist in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA files or
   HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,...
    keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioG,...
    minScoreRatioKO,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2018-04-03

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG
  • getPhylDist getPhylDist
This function is called by:

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function files=listFiles(directory)

0179 end

0182 end
0183 if isempty(outDir)
0184     outDir=tempdir;
0185     %Delete all *.out files if any exist
0186     delete(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0187 end
0188 if nargin<5
0189     keepUndefinedStoich=true;
0190 end
0191 if nargin<6
0192     keepIncomplete=true;
0193 end
0194 if nargin<7
0195     keepGeneral=false;
0196 end
0197 if nargin<8
0198     cutOff=10^-50;
0199 end
0200 if nargin<9
0201     minScoreRatioG=0.8;
0202 end
0203 if nargin<10
0204     minScoreRatioKO=0.3;
0205 end
0206 if nargin<11
0207     maxPhylDist=inf;
0208     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0209 end
0210 if nargin<12
0211     nSequences=inf;
0212     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0213 end
0214 if nargin<13
0215     seqIdentity=-1;
0216     %CD-HIT is not used in the pipeline
0217 end
0218 
0219 %Run the external binaries multi-threaded to use all logical cores assigned
0220 %to MATLAB
0221 cores = evalc('feature(''numcores'')');
0222 cores = strsplit(cores, 'MATLAB was assigned: ');
0223 cores = regexp(cores{2},'^\d*','match');
0224 cores = cores{1};
0225 
0226 %Checking if dataDir is consistent. It must point to pre-trained HMMs set,
0227 %compatible with the the current RAVEN version. The user may have the
0228 %required zip file already in working directory or have it extracted. If
0229 %the zip file and directory is not here, it is downloaded from BioMet
0230 %ToolBox 2.0 server.
0231 if ~isempty(dataDir)
0232     hmmOptions={'euk100_kegg82'; ...
0233         'euk90_kegg82'; ...
0234         'euk50_kegg82'; ...
0235         'prok100_kegg82'; ...
0236         'prok90_kegg82'; ...
0237         'prok50_kegg82'};
0238     if all(cellfun(@isempty,regexp(dataDir,strcat(hmmOptions,'$')))) % Check if dataDir ends with any of the hmmOptions
0239         EM='Pre-trained HMMs set is not recognised. It should match any of the following sets (which are available to download):';
0240         disp(EM);
0241         disp(hmmOptions);
0242         return;
0243     end
0244     if exist(dataDir,'dir')
0245         fprintf('Provided dataDir is in correct format for this RAVEN version in order to use pre-trained HMMs...\n')
0246     elseif ~exist(dataDir,'dir') && exist([dataDir,'.zip'],'file')
0247         fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0248         unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0249     else
0250         fprintf('Downloading HMMs archive file...\n');
0251         websave([dataDir,'.zip'],['http://biomet-toolbox.chalmers.se/tools/downloadable/files/',dataDir,'.zip']);
0252         fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0253         unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0254     end
0255 end
0256 
0257 %Check if the fasta-file contains '/' or'\'. If not then it's probably just
0258 %a file name. It is then merged with the current folder
0259 if any(fastaFile)
0260     if ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'\')) && ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'/'))
0261         fastaFile=fullfile(pwd,fastaFile);
0262     end
0263     %Create the required sub-folders in dataDir if they dont exist
0264     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),'dir')
0265         mkdir(dataDir,'keggdb');
0266     end
0267     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir')
0268         mkdir(dataDir,'fasta');
0269     end
0270     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir')
0271         mkdir(dataDir,'aligned');
0272     end
0273     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0274         mkdir(dataDir,'hmms');
0275     end
0276     if ~exist(outDir,'dir')
0277         mkdir(outDir);
0278     end
0279 end
0280 
0281 %First generate the full KEGG model. The dataDir mustn't be supplied as
0282 %there is also an internal RAVEN version available
0283 if any(dataDir)
0284     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0285 else
0286     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG([],keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0287 end
0288 fprintf('Completed generation of KEGG model\n');
0289 model.id=organismID;
0290 model.c=zeros(numel(model.rxns),1);
0291 
0292 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then just remove all genes which are not for
0293 %the given organism ID
0294 if isempty(fastaFile)
0295     if ismember(organismID,{'eukaryotes','prokaryotes'})
0296         phylDists=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0297         if strcmp(organismID,'eukaryotes')
0298             proxyid='hsa';
0299             %Use H. sapiens here
0300         else
0301             proxyid='eco';
0302             %Use E. coli here
0303         end
0304         [~, phylDistId]=ismember(proxyid,phylDists.ids);
0305         idsToKeep=phylDists.ids(~isinf(phylDists.distMat(phylDistId,:)));
0306         taxIDs=cellfun(@(x) x{1},cellfun(@(x) strsplit(x,':'),model.genes,'UniformOutput',false),'UniformOutput',false);
0307         I=ismember(upper(taxIDs),upper(idsToKeep));
0308     else
0309         %KEGG organism IDs may have three or four letters
0310         organismID=strcat(organismID,':');
0311         %Add colon for accurate matching
0312         if length(organismID)==4
0313             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:4),organismID),model.genes);
0314         elseif length(organismID)==5
0315             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:5),organismID),model.genes);
0316         end
0317     end
0318     %Remove those genes
0319     model.genes=model.genes(I);
0320     model.rxnGeneMat=model.rxnGeneMat(:,I);
0321 end
0322 
0323 %First remove all reactions without genes
0324 hasGenes=any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
0325 model=removeReactions(model,~hasGenes,true);
0326 
0327 %Clean gene names
0328 for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0329     %First get rid of the prefix organism id
0330     model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(strfind(model.genes{i},':')+1:end);
0331     %Find and remove the description in parentheses if any
0332     s=strfind(model.genes{i},'(');
0333     if any(s)
0334         model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(1:s-1);
0335     end
0336 end
0337 
0338 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then we're done here
0339 if isempty(fastaFile)
0340     %Create grRules
0341     model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0342     model.grRules(:)={''};
0343     %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0344     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0345         %Find the involved genes
0346         I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0347         model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0348         for j=2:numel(I)
0349             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0350         end
0351         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0352     end
0353     %Add geneMiriams, assuming that it follows the syntax
0354     %kegg.genes/organismID:geneName
0355     model.geneMiriams='';
0356     for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0357         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.name{1,1}='kegg.genes';
0358         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.value{1,1}=strcat(lower(organismID),model.genes{i,1});
0359     end
0360     return;
0361 end
0362 
0363 %Trim the genes so that they only contain information that can be matched
0364 %to the KEGG file of protein sequences (remove all information after first
0365 %parenthesis) NOTE: For some reason the organism abbreviation should be in
0366 %lower case in this database. Fix this here
0367 for i=1:numel(KOModel.genes)
0368     parIndex=strfind(KOModel.genes{i},'(');
0369     if any(parIndex)
0370         KOModel.genes{i}=KOModel.genes{i}(1:parIndex-1);
0371     end
0372     colIndex=strfind(KOModel.genes{i},':');
0373     KOModel.genes{i}=[lower(KOModel.genes{i}(1:colIndex-1)) KOModel.genes{i}(colIndex:end)];
0374 end
0375 
0376 %Create a phylogenetic distance structure
0377 phylDistStruct=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0378 [~, phylDistId]=ismember(model.id,phylDistStruct.ids);
0379 fprintf('Completed creation of phylogenetic distance matrix\n');
0380 
0381 %Calculate the real maximal distance now. An abitary large number of 1000
0382 %is used for the "all in kingdom" or "all sequences" options. This is a bit
0383 %inconvenient way to do it, but it's to make it fit with some older code
0384 if isinf(maxPhylDist) || maxPhylDist==-1
0385     maxPhylDist=1000;
0386 end
0387 
0388 %Get the KO ids for which files have been generated. Maybe not the neatest
0389 %way..
0390 fastaFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta','*.fa'));
0391 alignedFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.fa'));
0392 alignedWorking=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.faw'));
0393 hmmFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','*.hmm'));
0394 outFiles=listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0395 
0396 %Check if multi-FASTA files should be generated. This should only be
0397 %performed if there are IDs in the KOModel structure that haven't been
0398 %parsed yet
0399 missingFASTA=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[fastaFiles;alignedFiles;hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0400 
0401 if ~isempty(missingFASTA)
0402     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file')
0403         EM=fprintf(['The file ''genes.pep'' cannot be located at ' strrep(dataDir,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n']);
0404         dispEM(EM);
0405     end
0406     %Only construct models for KOs which don't have files already
0407     fastaModel=removeReactions(KOModel,setdiff(KOModel.rxns,missingFASTA),true,true);
0408     %Permute the order of the KOs in the model so that constructMultiFasta
0409     %can be run on several processors at once
0410     fastaModel=permuteModel(fastaModel,randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(fastaModel.rxns)),'rxns');
0411     constructMultiFasta(fastaModel,fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'));
0412 end
0413 fprintf('Completed generation of multi-FASTA files\n');
0414 
0415 %Get the directory for RAVEN Toolbox. This is to get the path to the third
0416 %party software used
0417 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0418 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0419 
0420 if isunix
0421     if ismac
0422         binEnd='.mac';
0423     else
0424         binEnd='';
0425     end
0426 elseif ispc
0427     binEnd='';
0428 else
0429     EM='Unknown OS, exiting.';
0430     disp(EM);
0431     return
0432 end
0433 
0434 %Check if alignment of FASTA files should be performed
0435 missingAligned=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[alignedFiles;hmmFiles;alignedWorking;outFiles]);
0436 if ~isempty(missingAligned)
0437     missingAligned=missingAligned(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingAligned)));
0438     %Align all sequences using MAFFT
0439     for i=1:numel(missingAligned)
0440         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0441         %parallel process. The faw-files are saved as temporary files to
0442         %kept track of which files are being worked on
0443         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0444             %Check that the multi-FASTA file exists. It should do so since
0445             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0446             %continue if not
0447             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0448                 EM=['WARNING: The multi-FASTA file for ' missingAligned{i} ' does not exist'];
0449                 dispEM(EM,false);
0450                 continue;
0451             end
0452             
0453             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0454             %file and continue
0455             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0456             if s.bytes<=0
0457                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'w');
0458                 fclose(fid);
0459                 continue;
0460             end
0461             
0462             %Create an empty file to prevent other threads to start to work
0463             %on the same alignment
0464             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'w');
0465             fclose(fid);
0466             
0467             %First load the FASTA file, then select up to nSequences
0468             %sequences of the most closely related species, apply any
0469             %constraints from maxPhylDist, and save it as a temporary file,
0470             %and create the model from that
0471             
0472             fastaStruct=fastaread(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0473             phylDist=inf(numel(fastaStruct),1);
0474             for j=1:numel(fastaStruct)
0475                 %Get the organism abbreviation
0476                 index=strfind(fastaStruct(j).Header,':');
0477                 if any(index)
0478                     abbrev=fastaStruct(j).Header(1:index(1)-1);
0479                     [~, index]=ismember(abbrev,phylDistStruct.ids);
0480                     if any(index)
0481                         phylDist(j)=phylDistStruct.distMat(index(1),phylDistId);
0482                     end
0483                 end
0484             end
0485             
0486             %Inf means that it should not be included
0487             phylDist(phylDist>maxPhylDist)=[];
0488             
0489             %Sort based on phylDist
0490             [~, order]=sort(phylDist);
0491             
0492             %Save the first nSequences hits to a temporary FASTA file
0493             if nSequences<=numel(fastaStruct)
0494                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order(1:nSequences));
0495             else
0496                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order);
0497             end
0498             
0499             %Do the alignment if there are more than one sequences,
0500             %otherwise just save the sequence (or an empty file)
0501             if numel(fastaStruct)>1
0502                 if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0503                     if ~ispc
0504                         if seqIdentity==1
0505                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0506                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0507                             tmpFile=tempname;
0508                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0509                             if status~=0
0510                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0511                                 dispEM(EM);
0512                             end
0513                             %Remove the old tempfile
0514                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0515                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0516                             end
0517                         elseif seqIdentity==0.9
0518                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0519                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0520                             cdhitInp90=tempname;
0521                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0522                             if status~=0
0523                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0524                                 dispEM(EM);
0525                             end
0526                             %Remove the old tempfile
0527                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0528                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0529                             end
0530                             tmpFile=tempname;
0531                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.9 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0532                             if status~=0
0533                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0534                                 dispEM(EM);
0535                             end
0536                             %Remove the old tempfile
0537                             if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0538                                 delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0539                             end
0540                         elseif seqIdentity==0.5
0541                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0542                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0543                             cdhitInp90=tempname;
0544                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0545                             if status~=0
0546                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0547                                 dispEM(EM);
0548                             end
0549                             %Remove the old tempfile
0550                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0551                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0552                             end
0553                             cdhitInp50=tempname;
0554                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' cdhitInp50 '" -c 0.9 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0555                             if status~=0
0556                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0557                                 dispEM(EM);
0558                             end
0559                             %Remove the old tempfile
0560                             if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0561                                 delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0562                             end
0563                             tmpFile=tempname;
0564                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp50 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.5 -s 0.8 -n 3 -M 2000']);
0565                             if status~=0
0566                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0567                                 dispEM(EM);
0568                             end
0569                             %Remove the old tempfile
0570                             if exist(cdhitInp50, 'file')
0571                                 delete([cdhitInp50 '*']);
0572                             end
0573                         end
0574                     else
0575                         %CD-HIT is not available in Windows so we just
0576                         %export multifasta file into temporary file;
0577                         tmpFile=tempname;
0578                         fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0579                     end
0580                 else
0581                     tmpFile=tempname;
0582                     fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0583                 end
0584                 %Do the alignment for this file
0585                 if ~ispc
0586                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305',['mafft' binEnd]) '" --auto --thread "' cores '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0587                 else
0588                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305','mafft.bat') '" --auto --thread "' cores '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0589                 end
0590                 if status~=0
0591                     EM=['Error when performing alignment of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0592                     dispEM(EM);
0593                 end
0594                 %Remove the old tempfile
0595                 if exist(tmpFile, 'file')
0596                     delete([tmpFile '*']);
0597                 end
0598             else
0599                 %If there is only one sequence then it's not possible to do
0600                 %a multiple alignment. Just print the sequence instead. An
0601                 %empty file was written previously so that doesn't have to
0602                 %be dealt with
0603                 if numel(fastaStruct)==1
0604                     fastawrite(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fastaStruct);
0605                 end
0606             end
0607             %Move the temporary file to the real one
0608             movefile(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'f');
0609         end
0610     end
0611 end
0612 
0613 if ~ispc
0614     if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0615         fprintf('Completed clustering and multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0616     else
0617         fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences. Protein clustering was not requested or incorrect seqIdentity value was used\n');
0618     end
0619 else
0620     if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0621         fprintf('Protein clustering was skipped, since CD-HIT is not compatible with Windows');
0622     end
0623     fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0624 end
0625 
0626 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0627 missingHMMs=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0628 if ~isempty(missingHMMs)
0629     missingHMMs=missingHMMs(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingHMMs)));
0630     
0631     %Train models for all missing KOs
0632     for i=1:numel(missingHMMs)
0633         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0634         %parallel process
0635         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'file')
0636             %Check that the aligned FASTA file exists. It could be that it
0637             %is still being worked on by some other instance of the program
0638             %(the .faw file should then exist). This should not happen on a
0639             %single computer. It doesn't throw an error, because it should
0640             %finalize the ones it can
0641             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']),'file')
0642                 EM=['The aligned FASTA file for ' missingHMMs{i} ' does not exist'];
0643                 dispEM(EM,false);
0644                 continue;
0645             end
0646             
0647             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0648             %file and continue
0649             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']));
0650             if s.bytes<=0
0651                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'w');
0652                 fclose(fid);
0653                 continue;
0654             end
0655             %Create a temporary file to indicate that it is working on the
0656             %KO. This is because hmmbuild cannot overwrite existing files
0657             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'w');
0658             fclose(fid);
0659             
0660             %Create HMM
0661             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmbuild' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' cores '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']) '"']);
0662             if status~=0
0663                 EM=['Error when training HMM for ' missingHMMs{i} ':\n' output];
0664                 dispEM(EM);
0665             end
0666             
0667             %Delete the temporary file
0668             delete(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']));
0669         end
0670     end
0671 end
0672 fprintf('Completed generation of HMMs\n');
0673 
0674 %Check which new .out files that should be generated Check if training of
0675 %Hidden Markov models should be performed
0676 missingOUT=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,outFiles);
0677 if ~isempty(missingOUT)
0678     missingOUT=missingOUT(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingOUT)));
0679     for i=1:numel(missingOUT)
0680         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0681         %parallel process
0682         if ~exist(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'file')
0683             %Check that the HMM file exists. It should do so since %we are
0684             %saving empty files as well. Print a warning and continue if
0685             %not
0686             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']),'file')
0687                 EM=['The HMM file for ' missingOUT{i} ' does not exist'];
0688                 dispEM(EM,false);
0689                 continue;
0690             end
0691             
0692             %Save an empty file to prevent several threads working on the
0693             %same file
0694             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0695             fclose(fid);
0696             
0697             %If the HMM file is empty then save an out file and continue
0698             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']));
0699             if s.bytes<=0
0700                 continue;
0701             end
0702             
0703             %Check each gene in the input file against this model
0704             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmsearch' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' cores '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fastaFile '"']);
0705             if status~=0
0706                 EM=['Error when querying HMM for ' missingOUT{i} ':\n' output];
0707                 dispEM(EM);
0708             end
0709             
0710             %Save the output to a file
0711             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0712             fwrite(fid,output);
0713             fclose(fid);
0714         end
0715     end
0716 end
0717 fprintf('Completed matching to HMMs\n');
0718 
0719 %***Begin retrieving the output and putting together the resulting model
0720 
0721 %Retrieve matched genes from the HMMs
0722 koGeneMat=zeros(numel(KOModel.rxns),3000); %Make room for 3000 genes
0723 genes=cell(3000,1);
0724 %Store the best score for a gene in a hash list (since it will be searching
0725 %many times)
0726 hTable = java.util.Hashtable;
0727 
0728 geneCounter=0;
0729 for i=1:numel(KOModel.rxns)
0730     if exist(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']), 'file')
0731         fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']),'r');
0732         beginMatches=false;
0733         while 1
0734             %Get the next line
0735             tline = fgetl(fid);
0736             
0737             %Abort at end of file
0738             if ~ischar(tline)
0739                 break;
0740             end
0741             
0742             if and(beginMatches,strcmp(tline,'  ------ inclusion threshold ------'))
0743                 break;
0744             end
0745             
0746             if beginMatches==false
0747                 %This is how the listing of matches begins
0748                 if any(strfind(tline,'E-value '))
0749                     %Read one more line that is only padding
0750                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0751                     beginMatches=true;
0752                 end
0753             else
0754                 %If matches should be read
0755                 if ~strcmp(tline,'   [No hits detected that satisfy reporting thresholds]') && ~isempty(tline)
0756                     elements=regexp(tline,' ','split');
0757                     elements=elements(cellfun(@any,elements));
0758                     
0759                     %Check if the match is below the treshhold
0760                     score=str2num(elements{1});
0761                     gene=elements{9};
0762                     if score<=cutOff
0763                         %If the score is exactly 0, change it to a very
0764                         %small value to avoid NaN
0765                         if score==0
0766                             score=10^-250;
0767                         end
0768                         %Check if the gene is added already and, is so, get
0769                         %the best score for it
0770                         I=hTable.get(gene);
0771                         if any(I)
0772                             koGeneMat(i,I)=score;
0773                         else
0774                             geneCounter=geneCounter+1;
0775                             %The gene was not present yet so add it
0776                             hTable.put(gene,geneCounter);
0777                             genes{geneCounter}=gene;
0778                             koGeneMat(i,geneCounter)=score;
0779                         end
0780                     end
0781                 else
0782                     break;
0783                 end
0784             end
0785         end
0786         fclose(fid);
0787     end
0788 end
0789 koGeneMat=koGeneMat(:,1:geneCounter);
0790 
0791 %Remove the genes for each KO that are below minScoreRatioKO.
0792 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,1)
0793     J=find(koGeneMat(i,:));
0794     if any(J)
0795         koGeneMat(i,J(log(koGeneMat(i,J))/log(min(koGeneMat(i,J)))<minScoreRatioKO))=0;
0796     end
0797 end
0798 
0799 %Remove the KOs for each gene that are below minScoreRatioG
0800 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,2)
0801     J=find(koGeneMat(:,i));
0802     if any(J)
0803         koGeneMat(J(log(koGeneMat(J,i))/log(min(koGeneMat(J,i)))<minScoreRatioG),i)=0;
0804     end
0805 end
0806 
0807 %Create the new model
0808 model.genes=genes(1:geneCounter);
0809 model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0810 model.grRules(:)={''};
0811 model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(numel(model.rxns),numel(model.genes));
0812 
0813 %Loop through the reactions and add the corresponding genes
0814 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0815     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0816         %Get all KOs
0817         I=find(strcmpi(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,'kegg.orthology'));
0818         KOs=model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I);
0819         %Find the KOs and the corresponding genes
0820         J=ismember(KOModel.rxns,KOs);
0821         [~, K]=find(koGeneMat(J,:));
0822         
0823         if any(K)
0824             model.rxnGeneMat(i,K)=1;
0825             %Also delete KOs for which no genes were found. If no genes at
0826             %all were matched to the reaction it will be deleted later
0827             L=sum(koGeneMat(J,:),2)==0;
0828             model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I(L))=[];
0829             model.rxnMiriams{i}.name(I(L))=[];
0830         end
0831     end
0832 end
0833 
0834 %Find and delete all reactions without any genes. This also removes genes
0835 %that are not used (which could happen because minScoreRatioG and
0836 %minScoreRatioKO)
0837 I=sum(model.rxnGeneMat,2)==0;
0838 model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
0839 
0840 %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0841 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0842     %Find the involved genes
0843     I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0844     model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0845     for j=2:numel(I)
0846         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0847     end
0848     model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0849 end
0850 
0851 %Fix grRules and reconstruct rxnGeneMat
0852 [grRules,rxnGeneMat] = standardizeGrRules(model,false); %Give detailed output
0853 model.grRules = grRules;
0854 model.rxnGeneMat = rxnGeneMat;
0855 end
0856 
0857 %Supporter function to list the files in a directory and return them as a
0858 %cell array
0859 function files=listFiles(directory)
0860 temp=dir(directory);
0861 files=cell(numel(temp),1);
0862 for i=1:numel(temp)
0863     files{i}=temp(i,1).name;
0864 end
0865 files=strrep(files,'.fa','');
0866 files=strrep(files,'.hmm','');
0867 files=strrep(files,'.out','');
0868 files=strrep(files,'.faw','');
0869 end
